snippet: A growing number of young people are now seen as converting to be better socially integrated in poor neighborhoods where Islam is dominant.
abstract: Memo from France; experts say yearly conversions to Islam in France have doubled in past 25 years, presenting growing challenge for country, where government and public attitudes toward Islam are awkward and sometimes hostile.
lead_paragraph: A growing number of young people are now seen as converting to be better socially integrated in poor neighborhoods where Islam is dominant.

headline.seo: Rise of Islamic Converts Challenges France
headline.main: More in France Are Turning to Islam, Challenging a Nation’s Idea of Itself
headline.print_headline: More in France Are Turning to Islam, Challenging a Nation’s Idea of Itself
